website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive wireless mouse is comfortable to use and works great to surf and search the internet. However, those with larger hands may want to consider other options.
pros: Comes in a wide variety of colors and styles
Features micro-precision scrolling to enhance Internet browsing
Contoured shape and textured rubber grip feel good in the hand
cons: Scrolling wheel does not offer enough tension, or stops working relatively quickly
Small-size mouse may not be the best choice for those with larger hands

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible across other Logitech peripherals
customer_reviews.text: Deceptive. You'd think that the antenna for the mouse would be compatible with all wireless Logitech peripherals. They are not. I returned for a refund, after talking with Logitech, after I found out that I needed a 'combo' keyboard/mouse. The mouse worked with IT'S antenna and my old Logitech keyboard worked with IT'S antenna. Good sales gimmick but poor way to keep customers. Five stars for the mouse, zero stars for compatibility with my keyboard so it averages out to three stars (not 2.5. Minus half a star for frustration.)
customer_reviews.author: JJ Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Ease of packaging opening!!!
customer_reviews.text: For Logitech - your products are always the best but this item arrived in the usual plastic wrapper with the exception that your packaging engineers designed this container with perforated periphery so there's no need to use a tool like scissors or whatever to open the "bubble"!!!! Or cut you fingers!!!!! Congrats to your designers for this great convenience!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Dumont

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, works well under both ends of heat extremities. Most will not work when temperatures are greater than body temperatures for a long time. This one does albeit not as good but better than most. For this I give it a 5 star rating. I have had one for over 5 years and it gave up on me a few weeks ago hence my purchase of this one. I bought two Amazon and Logitech. The Amazon mouse did not beyond week one, Logitech Mouse took over and it is still operational two weeks into operation. These Mouse/Mice are made to last and work and last in extreme conditions.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lenish

customer_reviews.title: Proved more robust than other Logitech mouse models
customer_reviews.text: I've had dozens of Logitech mouse devices over the years and one reason for so many is that the scroll wheels usually wear out. That is, it reaches the point where rotating the wheel results in much less actual scrolling on screen. The deterioration is usually gradual but eventually I need to replace the mouse. When it came time to buy some more, I checked around and noticed that the model M325 seemed to keep going while the others had all started to fail. So this time, I purchased three M325's (for three different computers). Hopefully I won't be writing mouse device reviews again for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: CFortC

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Rocks! Supreme Deals 18 is top notch seller.
customer_reviews.text: Most refurb's for mice are perfectly acceptable. They are tested and I have never had one issue with the refurb mice. Great little mouse, reasonable price and comes with a USB chip. I had to pair the chip to the mouse , but that was easy. Logitech has its unity software to do it quickly. I needed this for my son's computer at school. I did not want to spend a fortune on this just to possibly have it lost or stolen, so this was a perfect 45% off new, thanks to Supreme Deals and their refurb'd mouse. Looks new and works great
customer_reviews.author: KC of Indy

customer_reviews.title: These things work well, are are so rugged that I ordered them for GF and her daughter
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is a standard wireless mouse with the quality and durability you expect from Logitech. I have used this model for a couple of years for my work laptop. I liked it so well, that i also bought them for my girlfriend and her seven year old daughter to use on their computers. If they can take the abuse and repeated drops from a toddler from ages 5-7 and are STILL working after two year, i would say that these are pretty RUGGED.
customer_reviews.author: DickMcK

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Used to Be
customer_reviews.text: Not what it used to be. Like many other commenters, this thing lags and skips quite frequently. I tried using new batteries and switching the ubs locations, but to no avail. Strong pass on this one, even after owning an original for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Bass Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for about 4 months until the left mouse button started clicking multiple times
customer_reviews.text: The mouse was without fault until around the 4 month mark where clicking or holding down the left mouse button would sometimes release very quickly and then press again so single clicks would turn into double and triple clicks. I googled "online mouse test" and the first website shows how when the mouse is depressed by lighting up the picture of the mouse there. When the left mouse button was depressed it would sometime flash. I wanted to think it was something to do with the battery but I replaced the battery with brand new ones and had the same issue. This only happens with the left button; all others work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse... :)
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mouse. Works better than the built-in trackpad my keyboard has. Since both my keyboard & this mouse are Logitech, I didn't have to use the Unifying USB Receiver that came with this mouse. I'm keeping that stored in the mouse as a spare. :) This mouse really lets the cursor zip around the screen with the slightest movement when on the fastest pointer speed setting... even without the acceleration feature SetPoint provides. (don't turn that on unless you want your cursor flying away somewhere :3) Lots of bang for your buck with this mouse for sure. Definitely worth 5 stars... :D
customer_reviews.author: Technohead

customer_reviews.title: OK mouse, but very small
customer_reviews.text: Logitech mice are generally very good, but this one is quite small. I think a child or a small woman might find it fits their hand well, but most adults will find it too small. Yes, it's compact, so it fits well in a bag or briefcase. But when you're doing a lot of writing or other computer work, you really need something that fits your hand. Otherwise you'd probably be better off using your laptop's trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: bulegila

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I keep this mouse in my backpack k to use when I am doing a lot of clicking/scrolling/switching between documents. I like being able to leave the little USB in my computer so I just have to turn on the mouse and I'm ready to go. It's nice that I can also easily store the USB in the mouse when I don't want to leave it in my computer. The mouse is a nice size for my hand. I have short but fat fingers on a medium sized hand so mini mice just weren't comfortable for me to use. This is a great alternative. Good battery life as well.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working in 7 months!
customer_reviews.text: I have a M305 that is still going after 5 years. This mouse is cheaply made, and not sure if it has any warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Grandson

customer_reviews.title: Losing quality by the day!
customer_reviews.text: I had 4 Logitech mice stopped working in a span of little over a year. Earlier they used to work great for a very long time but not any more. Time to find some other brand that endures!
customer_reviews.author: James007

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few years now. It is great. The battery life is good. It works well on varying surfaces. It travels well. I really like the fact that I can store the USB transmitted in the mouse housing when I'm not using it. This keeps me from losing and damaging the USB transmitter. I also like that the USB transmitter is low profile. I am pretty careful with it, I don't recall having dropped it so not sure how it stands up to aggressive use. I has worked well for me. I really like it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: averagejoe

customer_reviews.title: Portable and ambidextrous, but interruptions in mouse connectivity are a deal-breaker
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this as my main mouse. Its small size, being wireless, decent battery life, and ambidextrous design make it good for travel and use in tight spaces. HOWEVER, I encounter interruptions in mouse connectivity, at worst a few times an hour. That can cause serious issues if, for instance, I happen to be dragging and dropping a file. Other Logitech mice I have owned are generally great and of high quality. Perhaps my experience with this model was atypical, but if not I cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful little mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse, and I have ordered many of them, for home, and for work. I order this one for many other people at work, specifically female coworkers. This is great for a smaller hand, or if you want a bit more compact mouse. It's nothing fancy, just a basic mouse, but I like it a lot. It works well, and I never get mad at it!
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Mice Mice Mice
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several of these to keep as backups in various places. I love these mice. I have them in several colors, and they have all held up well. I've had no problems with them, and the battery lasts a pretty long time. However, I do try to remember to turn it off to extend the life. I will keep purchasing these as long as I need a wireless mouse, which I prefer to use with my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: DoggyDoggy

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality product
customer_reviews.text: I buy these M325's for some of my staff of architects and drafters, so they get some serious workouts. I'd love to have a log of how many clicks it takes until the micro-switches give up. Interestingly, the latest worn out unit gave up the RIGHT-click side, which is used probably just 20-30% of the time. Overall, I can't say enough good things about Logitech products: Mice, track balls, and keyboards have all served my company well.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lavigne

customer_reviews.title: Tiny mouse that feels and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse! I use this guy with my laptop and it has seen a lot of abuse traveling the country with me. The battery life is amazing, easily lasts months on end. I haven't had it die on my yet, as I've replaced the batteries 3 months in out of paranoia. Despite its size, it's EXTREMELY comfortable and I'm picky when it comes to mice. Decent tracking as well, considering it's a basic wireless optical mouse. Love Logitech's tiny dongles (it fits in the mouse FYI!) and can be paired with their keyboards as well--one dongle two devices? Rad!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Fine out of box but failed at 2 months with light use
customer_reviews.text: Works fine as mouse for portable computer, with the caveat one's hand has to be OK with a rather small form factor. However, in less than 2 months the laser failed, which is too fast even for a unit used all day, every day....but this mouse has only accompanied me on trips, so about 2 weeks of use since purchase. My older Microsoft mouse (also small form factor) is chugging along at 2 years on my wife's computer.
customer_reviews.author: osguthjd

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: It isn't bad, but the wheel makes an irritating rasping noise, and the left-click function has to be punched very hard sometimes for it to work. I'll look for a better model when this one quits.
customer_reviews.author: Baumli

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 6 months, otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: excellent basic mouse for 6 months, now it won't turn on. tried new batteries and everything. never left my desk. used for about 2 hours/day, 5 days/week for administrative work. not sure what happened. great price, but would have paid more for something that will last
customer_reviews.author: symwolfclassic150

customer_reviews.title: It's small, light weight and easy to use and hold
customer_reviews.text: I won't be using it for gaming but I dropped my old one just like it that was red and broke something loose that caused the wheel to sometimes stop working. My fault. So, I bought another one just like it because it is my favorite mouse to use. The battery life is fine for my use which is just for the internet and work on my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: Solid as usual Logitech equipment, just not what I'm looking for
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is a perfectly serviceable mouse. It has Logitech's usual level of quality and performance, and connects right away to the unifying receiver. However, I'm still looking for a replacement for the discontinued Couch Mouse (M515), and while a solid performer as expected, it's not quite that. It's not just the lack of ability to easily use it on the arm of a recliner, it's also just not as solidly built and durable as the M515. I'll keep trying other Logitech products, maybe one day I'll find what I'm looking for.
customer_reviews.author: George Seymour III

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give some cheesy review about how I tried the rest now get the best blah blah. However; it works like I would expect a mouse to work. It’s got a smooth flow and the scroll wheel works very well. It fits in my hand and its not uncomfortable or awkward. Overall I’m happy with my mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Princessjenny

customer_reviews.title: Simple, practical, and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ive had a few of these mice at different jobs and decided to get one for myself instead of the crummy Lenovo mouse my new job gave me. It's a very comfortable grip, mouse wheel functions smoothly. Holds up great getting thrashed about in my computer bag. Overall I just really like the clean simple styling and how it fits in my hand. I dont like overly complicated designs or having 8 buttons on my mouse.
customer_reviews.author: J_Mech

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these because I like them so much. They are the best fit for my medium sized hands. The battery lasts a long time on them too. I have been using this one at work everyday for several months and have not had to change the battery. My favorite feature is being able to use the mouse wheel to go back a page while browsing. However, this feature often stops working if you transport the mouse in a backpack a lot.
customer_reviews.author: pastir

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse on my Mac.
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse on my Mac. I got tired of having to beg my Bluetooth mouse to wake up and constantly changing batteries. This mouse is always there and ready to go whenever I need it. Also, the responsiveness overall is far superior to my Bluetooth mouse. Long battery life is a plus too. Since I already had a Logitech keyboard with a unifying receiver, I didn’t have to use up another USB port to use this mouse. Overall a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Coult

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse for everyday use such as school. It works great, battery lasts a long time and I have yet to have any issues. The only thing i would say is this shouldn't be a gaming mouse if thats what you're looking for. It's small enough your hand will cramp after a small while of playing because of its small size.
customer_reviews.author: D-Rock

customer_reviews.title: Fits my hand well
customer_reviews.text: This particular brand/style fits my hand well. Was just trial and error and these have worked for me for at least 5 years. Last one lasted about 2 years; might have lasted longer if I did not drop it now and then. Amazon asks to rate some features including "gaming". I don't game so can't rate that feature.
customer_reviews.author: EnJay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have used this since I bought it, and only changed the battery once. (and I think it was a faulty battery at that) It is fantastic! I can be far away from my computer and it still works. My shoulder used to hurt from using the touch pad or the traditional mouse. With this, I can relax my shoulder in any position. I can even put it under the covers with my laptop on the covers while laying in bed, (or reclined) and it still works fine. Very Satisfied. Would buy 10 more if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie A. Posey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to keyboards and mice, Logitech is unquestionably number one! Among other things, I love the Logitech Unifying Software feature which allows a user of up to six different wireless Logitech products to connect to the computer using a single receiver, thus freeing up USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: SigmaSpace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little mouse
customer_reviews.text: While I was initially surprised at how much smaller this mouse is compared to my old mouse, it has not been a problem for me. I thought it was going to be too small, but after only having used it for a few days, I am already acclimated to it. I had been using a corded mouse and I am so much happier with this wireless mouse. So much faster and no cord snagging. I don't even use a mouse pad and it works perfect. I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, not cheap...
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse for low $$$ - I was expecting something much more chintzy for ifteen-fay-ish dollars, but it had a lot of nice Pro's: + On/Off Switch + Page Back/Forward (in web browser, Windows Explorer, etc.) on scroll button left/right click + Small USB Dongle + Compatible with other Logitech unifying devices + Easily recognized by Windows 10 + Scrolling and pointing are very precise + Battery Life It's only real Con's are that - it wasn't free - it took two days to arrive instead of showing up instantaneously
customer_reviews.author: MJP

customer_reviews.title: replacement for m305
customer_reviews.text: After many years my little Logitech M305 finally broke and I was dismayed that I couldn't just get another one. One seller wanted $149 can you imagine? Anyway, I got this and it is just fine. I hope to get many years from it just like the one it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Not Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this 4 stars cause it still gets the job done. Though I have to admit that I am not a fan of it. Feels too small under my hand and I have small hands. I feel that it is super slick and not good to grasp especially on the sides. I feel my hand cramp while I use it since I have to hold it tighter in order to get it to stay in my hand. Not impressed but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah & Keith Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse replacement
customer_reviews.text: My old wireless mouse just died after 8 years of service and I was desperate for a replacement. This filled the void at a reasonable price. Smaller USB edge sticking out from my laptop is a plus. Mouse fits nicely in my hand and is almost as good as my old one from HP. I have always had good luck with Logitech products. The only issue I have is that the wheel is a bit too loose in scrolling around. I was used to a firmer wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and in excellent condition. I've owned similar mice in the past and live the size and style of this one. The one thing I don't like is that there's no forward/back side-swipe gesture for the scroll wheel. I used that feature often when browsing the web or navigating Windows explorer.
customer_reviews.author: Drpiercy

customer_reviews.title: Great travel mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great travel mouse. Compact size but not micro like the one size down. Unifying dongle is kinda cool. I have a Logitech for the office that als uses the unifying feature Makes it so I don’t have to worry about the dongle if I travel or need to use my computer at home. Basic programmable buttons is a plus as well.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little wireless mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Logitech wireless mouse I buy the first one I purchesed lasted me about two years and gave up on me. I changed up the battery a few time to see if it would work but nothing. I am hoping this does not happen to this one because I love how compact it is and it fits just right on the hand. It has a high middle grip which feel natural in the hands. Logitech has always been my perfered choice hope it does not fail me again.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I had the same mouse for my work computer, and I really liked it. That's why I got another one for my home computer. The wheel in the mouse is working really fast and it is very useful when I scroll down a page quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Frida

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about getting this mouse due to my prior experience with Logitech mice. They were always slow no matter how I changed the setting for the pointer. This one is definitely the exception. It glides smoothly on the screen; no adjustments needed. The Bluetooth transmitter was plug and play and made the mouse work as soon as I plugged it in. Definitely a big improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Jose P

customer_reviews.title: A+++ Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Always a pleasure to get a new logitech mouse. This is a plain jane one - the ones with designs were too spendy when I needed one. My last one wore out sooner than I would have expected. I love the smaller size of this mouse as it fits my hand better for heavy use. Grateful that the Logitech name remains synonymous with quality!
customer_reviews.author: janea

customer_reviews.title: Saved by my mouse
customer_reviews.text: I don't use a tracking pad well and I found myself with my laptop and no mouse - Amazon to the rescue -this seller is very reliable. I received my product early and the mouse is very high quality and even comes with a battery. The thumb drive fits inside the mouse so when you travel you will not loose it - very cleaver.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best mouse I've ever owned, (and I've tried a lot of different makes and models). I have several, actually, one for my work computer, one each for my home computers and another one for an ASUS tablet/laptop. I also have several in "reserve" in case one fails, which doesn't happen often, if at all. Overall, a great mouse and a great value. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Osvaldo Murgo

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly good little wireless mouse. Obviously it is tiny and ill-suited to gaming or serious long-term use. I bought it to operate a Raspberry Pi connected to my TV, so it's fantastic for that! Good reliability at 10 ft.
customer_reviews.author: LoneIgadzra

customer_reviews.title: Buy technology items, recommend go to the local store
customer_reviews.text: Not reliable, I just bought it for 6 moths, it is not working anymore even with new battery, I cannot figure out what is wrong. I will get another one from the local community store. It works much better and reliable. The one I bought from local store for my son several years, he is still using it.
customer_reviews.author: AY

customer_reviews.title: A Cool Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works much better than the higher end logitech that I had been using. As soon as I put the battery in it and connected the antenna, the mouse was recognized by my computer. I was good to go immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Smith

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in November of 2016, and it has worked very well until today, January 9, 2018. It has been used at least 6 hours a day since, so I'd say it held up pretty well. The only drawback, is that it is rather small, and may not be suitable for people with larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: JJ F.

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: im not sure if the seller sold me a fake one or this model has defects, but mine stopped working after few months. my computer won't recognize it. i tried to update the driver, etc but i still couldn't get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BOTHER! Cuts out constantly.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse cuts out constantly and even if you turn it off then back on then it cuts out within 30 seconds again. Replaced the batteries 4 times and still does it. Even with Duracell Quantum batteries. It's got a mind of it's own. I'll probably be taking a sledgehammer to this thing very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Having tried many wired and wireless mice, this is my favorite
customer_reviews.text: After having tried many wired and wireless mice on the market, this has become my favorite wireless mouse. It is compact, feels great in the hand, is very reliable, has great battery life, and is inexpensive. It works great as a travel mouse or as a daily use mouse, and I have used it with both Windows PCs and Macs and have had no issues in either environment. There is a cover on the bottom that slides open for access to the AA battery and to a little notch where you can store the USB receiver if you're traveling. I have been easily getting 12+ month of battery life with daily use. Just a really great unit.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again, very good mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This little mouse is great. It has a storage case built into the battery compartment. I love the Logitech USB adapter. No lag, no problems working on a desk without a mouse pad. I have the single adapter in my laptop. I use this little mouse on the go and then leave it in my backpack so I don't forget it. Then at home on my desk I have a fullsize Logitech mouse that just seamlessly works with the little USB connector. Only drawback is that the mouse cannot be charged over USB. So you have to take out the battery and replace it, about every 2-3 weeks for me, used maybe 20 hours a week in class.
customer_reviews.author: AlexLovesAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Installation is impossible
customer_reviews.text: Fitting the ear muffs into the headphone cup turned out to be impossible. I tore the left side muff trying to get it underneath the little clips built into the headphone cup. In my opinion the design of the ring that the foam and leather attach to is faulty. Never again. Only Bose originals from now on.
customer_reviews.author: SS Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Work fine, but is it a genuine Logitech?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this is a genuine Logitech product. The label is written differently from another Logitech mouse I own. Plus, the scroll wheel does not have a nice tactile feedback like my old Logitech mouse. But everything does work right out of the packaging. I do like the much smaller USB receiver compared to my old mouse that hangs out about 1 1/2".
customer_reviews.author: A. Truong

customer_reviews.title: Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had two M325 wireless mouse and both would not move the mouse pointer on the screen after 1 year of light use. Nice feature is the scroll left and rightbutton can move back and forward on web pages.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This Is The GO-TO Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I must have bought ten of these ... work, home, friends, kids ... If someone liked it, I would just give them mine, since I always had a spare sitting on the shelf. Failure-free.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Love Logitech
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 2 of these and I love them. They work on most surfaces and are small enough to pack but large enough to not cramp my hands. The battery life is extremely long (I consistently forget to turn these off) so much that I've only replaced the battery a couple of times in the last two years. Good for a variety of desks and tables and pretty durable (I work in a science lab). All in all Logitech seems to have some really good stuff and has been a great company to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Sigil

customer_reviews.title: I have six of these now, and they all ...
customer_reviews.text: I have six of these now, and they all work well. I do find that the older ones (several years) occasionally stop working, but all it takes to get them working again is to remove and reinsert the battery. The battery is a single AA cell and lasts a long time, of the order of a year.
customer_reviews.author: alphazetaomega

customer_reviews.title: I love it because it glides easily over surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Burned out on Logitech, bought Apple Magic mouse, decided to go with reviews and bought this one. I love it because it glides easily over surfaces, including 3M pads and my macbook pro keyboard while it's in my lap. Requires only 1 battery with the power of 2 battery types. Fits perfectly in my small hand. The cursor is under control most of the time and doesn't jump around too much. I'm happy at last!
customer_reviews.author: AnnieTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is only skin deep Buyers beware
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was pretty good for the price ....the only thing I didn't like was the scrolling wheel ....it is ideal to have some tension while turning it....you don't want it to keep scrolling after you take your finger off the wheel........I got use to it though. I can understand if a product is dead on arrival or shortly after it happens to the best brand names. I question the quality of this particular model made by Logitech because it could not stand up to 6 months of normal wear and tear.....So I give it one star
customer_reviews.author: Jerrybens

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. This is replacing an amazon basics one that is similar in size (kind of small, but still comfortable enough). Its sensitivity feels a bit high but of course that can be changed in the OS and it might have to do with being new. I was a little concerned about the Logitech logo looking different than the one shown in the main product picture. I thought maybe I received some Chinese ripoff thanks to how the description also mentions it originating from China. Turns out the Logitech logo was updated.
customer_reviews.author: RedMage1993

customer_reviews.title: Compact, well-designed
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and functional! This mouse is compact, which makes it great for laptop use and travel. The USB connector is low-profile so you don't have to worry about it bumping into stuff or getting damaged. I leave mine plugged in constantly, but if you need to use it on multiple computers, you can tuck the USB connector into the mouse (in with the battery). The scroll wheel works well and the tilt-clicks default to back/forward for web-browsing. It has a battery life indicator on the top so it is easy to see when the battery is getting low, plus an on/off switch on the bottom to help save battery life. Strongly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is the worst I've ever had. It just feels cheap. Really light, no substance to it. very awkward in my hand. Highly inaccurate. This is not a good mouse if you need to work quickly or accurately. When I'm trying to work fast, if I move the mouse to click on something the cursor ends up way past the intended target. I have to think way too much to use this, it's distracting.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Purchase. I Wore Out The Original!
customer_reviews.text: I got excellent use out of this same mouse I bought several years ago. It just couldn't take the abuse I gave it anymore. So I had to buy another one! Fits me well!
customer_reviews.author: wiiasm

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Been buying this and similar Logi's for year, can't go wrong for the money. What I like (outside of funtion) is the varied color and pattern options which allows you to know what rat is for what computer.
customer_reviews.author: Versed

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth Action. I love the hidden compartment for the USB inside the battery area. Fits my SMALL adult hand perfectly. Great deal.. This one can't be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Kings

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works great only thing is, I added an extended usb cord the make transmitter be in the open because it was erratic when it was behind my NVR. Once I added the extended usb it worked great
customer_reviews.author: bob d

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out after two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse crapped out after two weeks of moderate use. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Not Jenna's Account

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality! Works well. Only problem I had was that that the mouse did not work so well after a year. I would turn my computer on and off and it would work for an hour or so and then I would have to keep switching the USB portals. Sometimes it works and sometimes it did not. The mouse did work for a whole year. Some of you may get lucky and it may work longer. I got a good year out of it though.
customer_reviews.author: Livestrong

customer_reviews.title: Great little mouse!
customer_reviews.text: The fit of this mouse feels right in my hand, and the mechanism is very responsive. The webpage advance/go-back feature by clicking sideways on the scroll wheel is a cool trick. The scroll wheel is finely tuned with micro-stops along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I travel with my laptop. It is reliable, works well, long battery life, nice size and weight w/ batteries, comfortable in my hand. If you have the hands of an NBA All-Star your mileage may vary!
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: As expected from the brand "Logitech", their products are always good. This wireless mouse is perfect for my laptop use, even for gaming. It fits my hand perfectly and the zoom in/zoom out roller is very smooth. I like the fact that it only uses one AA battery, which saves money and hassle. All I have to do was plug in my wireless usb into my laptop, and waited for it to self-install. No hassle, it was easy to install and use. They also provide you with a free battery!
customer_reviews.author: Shi L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Hands
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchase this as it is reliable and fits well in a smaller hand. The first one I had for several years and would toss it in my purse with my Surface Pro and go, so it took a real beating with no issues to performance. So when it came time to replace it, of course I found the same model! Would recommend to those who want a smaller sized durable mouse.
customer_reviews.author: J Tousley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size/weight. Left tilt = Back button
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mouse for desktop or laptop. I have longer fingers, and prefer to lift the mouse, not my hand. This glides along my desk easily, as I use 3 monitors (24-30-24). The scroll wheel's left tilt feature is my favorite, as it automatically is the Back button in my browser. I couldn't get that to work any Microsoft mouse. Not too heavy; not too light (like the M185).
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: In less than 6 months, the scroll wheel partially stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked fine until a little over 5 months after purchase. Now the scroll wheel only functions when you spin it fast, which makes it next to useless for using certain apps and for say, scrolling through online articles as you read. This basic functionality should not break so quickly for a quality mouse. My previous one lasted several years before it started exhibiting issues.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This was replacement of one I purchased a couple years ago. Exactly what I ordered but within 1-1/2 weeks battery was dead! in fact, used only about four days, perhaps total of 10-15 hours!! Had the pull tab to activate and turned off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: E. MICHAUD

customer_reviews.title: The mouse was fine but the usb connector broke pretty easily
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure what to say about this. The mouse was fine but the usb connector broke pretty easily. The plastic casing came off in a couple of days and eventually broke. It was misused a fair bit by my girlfriend but I still expected better quality.
customer_reviews.author: jolszewski

customer_reviews.title: This was my last one.
customer_reviews.text: Bad experience. It is a good mouse as long as it works. I had a few because I like how it handles. But none of them lasted more than one year (in a clean, well ordered environment). It is NOT worth about $50. A few months ago, I contacted Logitech and got a replacement for the last broken one. Meanwhile this new one failed too. I tried to get in touch with Logitech again. All known e-mail addresses do NOT work. The support form does NOT work either. Which is quite irritating for people who canNOT or do NOT want to call. A disappointment! I will have to find a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Iz Gewd
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good mouse. Feels very comfortable to me as the side grips make it easy to hold on to as opposed to an ordinary mouse. And for the price, you can't beat it. My PC runs Windows 10 and it works very smooth with it, no issues whatsoever thus far. If I had to pick one thing to improve about it however, I would say the scroll wheel feels a little shaky as if it would break if accidentally impacted or whatnot. Other than that,definitely a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: I get it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice wireless mouse for a laptop with no large dongle sticking out the side. And what is also nice I can pick up my mouse and go to the office and use the same mouse as long as it also has a tiny Logitech Unifying receiver with a orange circle on the bottom it. Some people just don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: JRD

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This mouse seemed alright at first but then I noticed something. Whenever I move the mouse to the left or right it goes down at the same time. Makes painting in Photoshop VERY annoying. Even after dealing with that, the mouse starts jumping across the screen every now and then. Making it basically impossible to use. I would get a refund if I could but I don't have a printer!
customer_reviews.author: aMTM

customer_reviews.title: not a good choice
customer_reviews.text: The mouse simply doesn't work properly. It does not respond to the simplest command which is clicking on an icon and opening it. I bought 2, one for my desk top in the office and one for my laptop at home. Unsatisfied!!! Spend a little more and buy a better one.
customer_reviews.author: roso

customer_reviews.title: Received in broken package
customer_reviews.text: The plastic bubble encasing the mouse was broken and the dongle was missing. I returned it with no hassle and bought a new one at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus Mcthumbs

customer_reviews.title: Basic little mouse gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty basic little travel mouse. But it works well and there is a little or no setup involved depending on your system.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maccollin

customer_reviews.title: Its great for about a year...
customer_reviews.text: It's great for about a year then it stops working. I will continue to buy a new one every year until I find a suitable replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnyday

customer_reviews.title: Works but too small even for my small hands.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but it is so small that my small hand gets cramped after a while using it steadily. My hand ends up feeling like a crab claw! I'm looking for a mouse that is bigger so that my hand can spread out more.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Well... Hmmm
customer_reviews.text: I normally love logitech ...but this particular purchase stopped working after a couple months
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With a Mac
customer_reviews.text: I have never liked a mouse that was too big. This one fits my hand well. My hands are medium for a man, although I think most women would like the size of this mouse as well. It is comfortable to use. There is nothing complex or elaborate about it. With any current plug and play system, simply plug in the receiver, wait until it is install and use it. You may have to adjust the speed it moves or the click speed. I don't use the web scrolling "feature." This is just not my cup of tea. Pros: A simple easy to use, well fit mouse Cons: None so far as I'm concerned
customer_reviews.author: Hal B

customer_reviews.title: Mouse stopped working after less than 90 days
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse just under three months ago and it randomly stopped working. When it worked, I loved this mouse but I am not impressed with the durability. I have checked my computer with other mice and they all work fine. Unfortunately, this product hasn't' held up to normal (at my desk) use.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Hart

customer_reviews.title: M325 Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love this little mouse it works great on my laptop computer. I bought one for my desktop and liked it so well that I decided to buy another one for my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B.

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive screen navigation
customer_reviews.text: This mouse does a great job of settling all commands. I'm using it now. Effortless. Another great Logitech product
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: First, the battery that came in the unit didn't last very long, The " click" is a little more noticeable than my previous mouse and its a little smaller. I have gotten use to it now, its working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: wade

customer_reviews.title: Great "little" mouse
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I dislike, I had the exact same mouse that lasted 9 years, just had to change the battery a few times, but roller on top just finally wore out and would not scroll, had to use the sidebar to scroll down. I really like the size, it is small and fits in my hand and there is a lot of times I have limited space to work on so this mouse works Great. Plus a great price. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy!!!
customer_reviews.text: The wheel button on the mouse is amazing. I can click it to the left to go back a webpage and to the right to go forward a webpage. Also when I click strait down on the wheel, on a link, it will open on a new tab!! Such conscience in such a small thing.
customer_reviews.author: aloverofbooks

customer_reviews.title: Alright cheap mouse, great seller
customer_reviews.text: Review for the seller, product stopped responding a couple months in and the seller immediately shipped me a new one with no fuss. As for the product, not as steady as the M305 but decent for a simple mouse. While it worked anyway.
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's very compact in size easy to carry. Also Unify compatible. From left M570, M510 and M325 for size comparison.
customer_reviews.author: A Biswas

customer_reviews.title: Great form but doesnt work well on a lot of surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I like the micro wheel but will say I dont use the wheel for anything other than scrolling. If you're using it for clicking, I can see how it's impossible to hold the wheel still. My biggest gripe is the tracking of this mouse. It doesn't work on all surfaces like my old M505 logitech mouse did. Any sort of pattern in the surface is picked up by the M325 and makes the pointer go all over the place. Wood pattern on a desktop, or the fabric pattern of a neoprene mouse pad are two examples. Too bad. I really liked the form of this mouse otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic1

customer_reviews.title: Love this portable mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love this portable mouse. Reliable and accurate input. Occasionally, the mouse will stop responding and I have to remove the battery then reinstall it. But otherwise, it's a great mouse. The scroll wheel functions are great....you can click back and forth through folders and web pages in addition to scrolling up and down. I own 2 or 3 of these and just love them. Feels great in your hand, not too small or large. My local Staples has these for $12!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think I'd write a 1-star for a good brand like Logitech
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I'd write a 1-star for a good brand like Logitech, but I ordered this mouse, turned it on, hooked it to 3 different laptops and PC's, tried 5 new batteries...but there was no active LED light on the underside and no mouse movement... A dud... Should I trust this was a 1 in 10,000 chance and order another one? I'm an idiot, so I probably will.
customer_reviews.author: William S Wightman

product_meta.title: Logitech M325 Wireless Mouse for Web Scrolling - Black
product_meta.description: Color:Plane BlackThe Logitech Wireless Mouse M325-a better mix of precision and comfort. With its designed-for-Web scrolling, now everything you love to do online is easier System Requirements: Windows Vista or Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|Mac OS X 10.5 or later|Linux kernel 2.6+|USB port
feature_bullets: 2.4 GHz connectivity provides fast transmission and virtually no delays
Micro-precise scrolling makes everything you love to do online easier
Contoured shape keeps your hand happy through hours of use
Unifying receiver allows simultaneous use with compatible devices
18-Month Battery life delivers lasting use without frequent Battery changes
2.4 GHz connectivity provides fast transmission and virtually no delays
Note : In case of Wireless mouse, the USB receiver will be provided inside or along with the mouse
Micro-precise scrolling makes everything you love to do online easier
Contoured shape keeps your hand happy through hours of use
Unifying receiver allows simultaneous use with compatible devices
Micro-precise scrolling: New designed-for-web scrolling makes searches, shopping and browsing easier
Feel-good design: Contoured shape and textured rubber grips keep your hand comfortable even after long hours
Long battery life: Up to 18 months of battery life virtually eliminates the need to change batteries (** Battery life may vary based on user and computing conditions.)
For Windows, Mac and Linux: Reliable wireless connection with tiny Logitech Unifying receiver that can stay in your laptop
Logitech Advanced Optical Tracking: Enjoy point-and-click precision

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,231 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
